intro: Patagonium coluteoides, commonly known as the Patagonian cress, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many mustard plants. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, thriving in cool and temperate climates. It features small, white or pale yellow flowers and has a branched stem with alternate, linear leaves. Patagonium coluteoides is known for its ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it an important component of alpine ecosystems.
